articles.title: Skeletons of Incan kids buried 500 years ago found marred with smallpox - Livescience.com
articles.description: Archaeologists in Peru have discovered two 16th-century toddler burials with evidence of smallpox, indicating that the foreign illness spread quickly with European contact.
articles.content: A 16th-century cemetery in Peru holds the remains of two toddlers whose skeletons still show the devastating impact of smallpox in the early-colonial period. The rare find may hold key information ab… [+4965 chars]
